{"step_by_step_thinking": "The normal range for the white blood cell count varies slightly among different laboratories, but a typical range is usually between 4,000 and 11,000 per microliter of blood. This can also be referred to as the leukocyte count and can be expressed in international units as 4.0 - 11.0 x 109 cells per liter. The other options are either too high or too low to be considered normal.", "answer_choice": "A"}
